Description: Stem and foot sherd (two unjoined but joining fragments) of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery stemmed dish; pale slip; exterior painted black with the exception of two reserved bands near the top; third band near junction of stem and foot; edge of foot reserved with four groups of three vertical bars; underside of foot reserved with three bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
According to personal communcation from J.M. Cook (1972) merely briefly describing object as East Greek fruit dish dated circa 600BC..
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.876)
